parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and echo; to hold upon, i.e. to retain; to detain; to pay attention to.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To pick out for myself, choose, elect, select. Middle voice from ek and lego; to select.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From protos and klisia; a reclining first at the dinner-bed, i.e. Preeminence at meals.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From paraballo; a similitude, i.e. fictitious narrative, apothegm or adage.
